Information: Betel leaves are used for ,Gastro Protective Activity,,Anti-malarial Agent,Improves Oral Health,Anti-asthmatic Agent,Helps in Wound Healing,Anti-cancer Agent,etc.
Procedure:
Oral Health:Chewing: One of the most common traditional uses of betel leaves is chewing them with areca nut (betel nut) and slaked lime (calcium hydroxide). This practice, known as paan,is believed to improve oral health, freshen breath, and aid in digestion. However, it's essential to note that this practice may increase the risk of oral cancer and other health issues, especially when combined with tobacco or betel nut.

Wound Healing:Topical Application: Crush fresh betel leaves into a paste and apply it directly to wounds or cuts. The antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties of betel leaves may help promote wound healing and prevent infection.

Anti-asthmatic Effects:Steam Inhalation: Boil betel leaves in water and inhale the steam to help relieve symptoms of asthma and other respiratory conditions. The aromatic compounds in betel leaves may help alleviate congestion and promote easier breathing.
